key_points: Wisconsin prosecutors seek to introduce evidence of Kyle Rittenhouse's past violent incident in his trial.
The state's motion aims to show Rittenhouse's association with the far-right Proud Boys group.
Rittenhouse, 18, is charged with the fatal shooting of two men and wounding another during police brutality protests in Kenosha.
Prosecutors want to introduce a video from July 1, 2020, showing Rittenhouse striking a teenage girl in Kenosha.
The motion highlights Rittenhouse's alleged pattern of seeking out violent situations to commit further acts of violence.
Photos from January show Rittenhouse with members of the Proud Boys, making a white power symbol gesture.
Alleged association with Proud Boys is cited to demonstrate Rittenhouse's pride in violence.
Rittenhouse is accused of traveling to Kenosha in response to a call to protect businesses during protests.
Black Lives Matter supporters view him as a white supremacist, while some conservatives see him as a symbol for gun rights.
Rittenhouse's trial is scheduled to start on Nov. 1.
